Set PCA variances

Set PCA variances

pca_variances(x, ...) <- value

Arguments

x

SCtkE object
...

other parameters
value

PCA variances DataFrame()

Value

A SCtkExperiment object with the pca_variances slot set.

Examples

data("GSE60361_subset_sce")
pca_variances(GSE60361_subset_sce)
#> DataFrame with 30 rows and 1 column
#>        percentVar
#>         <numeric>
#> PC1    0.37677828
#> PC2    0.08759633
#> PC3    0.05694270
#> PC4    0.03516177
#> PC5    0.03255553
#> ...           ...
#> PC26 1.154553e-02
#> PC27 1.041788e-02
#> PC28 9.644153e-03
#> PC29 8.957024e-03
#> PC30 7.430641e-32
#getPCA() sets the pca_variances
newSCE <- getPCA(GSE60361_subset_sce, use_assay = "counts")

#alternatively, set the pca_variances directly
pca <- prcomp(assay(GSE60361_subset_sce, "logcounts"))
percentVar <- pca$sdev ^ 2 / sum(pca$sdev ^ 2)
pca_variances(GSE60361_subset_sce) <- DataFrame(percentVar)

  • Value
